result.execSummary:
All charges against Dayvion M Graham in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dayvion M Graham is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dayvion M Graham

records.addlTxt: Defendant Dayvion M Graham in court.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   State's essential witness is NOT present in court, therefore, the State is unable to proceed today.  No alternative theory.  Motion to dismiss by the defense argued and GRANTED by the Court.  Case dismissed without prejudice. Defendant Dayvion M Graham in court.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Defendant Dayvion M Graham in court.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court on State's Joinder motion filed. Court GRANTS Joinder motion and adopts the reasons as stated in the motion to join this case with 21CF3775. Case calendared for Jury Trial, Branch 4.  Jury trial scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dayvion M Graham in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for motion with final pre-trial on case 21CF3775.  State just filed joinder motion defense counsel has not had time to file a response. Court grants Defense motion for adjournment. Court orders defense counsel file response by 7/15/22 either way. Case remains calendared in Branch 4. Adjourned final motion hearing scheduled for 8/1/22 at 9:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6.29.22, filed.  rmm

Prior: 4819 North 36th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53216

Kawanna B.

No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court order bail $500.00 signature bond. Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Dayvion M Graham in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1.   
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Arguments heard as to bail. Court order $500.00 signature bond and same conditions as felony case 2021CF3775. State requesting joinder and that case remain in Branch 4 until joinder motion heard. Court grants. Court orders state's joinder motion due 5-6-2022 and defense reply due 5-27-2022. Defense maybe be objecting to joinder, however requests trial dates on felony matter. Case adjourned in Branch 4.

  Motion hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
